content: Fundamentals Valuation Stocks Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 18 Mar 2019What is free cashflow to the firm?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Zann ChuaLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 Mar 2019Hello!The free cashflow to the firm can be used to measure a company's profitability after all expenses and reinvestments. It can be used to compare and analyze a firm's financial health. A positice free cash flow would indicate that the firm still has cash left after taking expenses into account. While a negative value would mean that the firm has not generated enough revenue to cover its cost and investment activities. Hope this helps !0 comments1
